author-notes.title: Article Information
author-notes.p: Open Access: This is an open access article distributed under the terms of the CC-BY License. © 2019 Vilcu A-M et al. JAMA Network Open.
author-notes.corresp: Corresponding Author: Ana-Maria Vilcu, MSc, Sorbonne Université, INSERM, Institut Pierre Louis d’épidémiologie et de Santé Publique (IPLESP UMRS 1136), 27 rue Chaligny, 75571 Paris Cedex 12, France ( ana-maria.vilcu@upmc.fr).
author-notes.p: Author Contributions: Ms Vilcu had full access to all of the data in the study and takes responsibility for the integrity of the data and the accuracy of the data analysis.
Concept and design: Vilcu, Sabatte, Blanchon, Souty, Steichen, Hanslik.
Acquisition, analysis, or interpretation of data: Vilcu, Blanchon, Souty, Maravic, Lemaitre, Steichen, Hanslik.
Drafting of the manuscript: Vilcu, Sabatte, Hanslik.
Critical revision of the manuscript for important intellectual content: Vilcu, Blanchon, Souty, Maravic, Lemaitre, Steichen, Hanslik.
Administrative, technical, or material support: Blanchon, Souty.
Conflict of Interest Disclosures: None reported.
Funding/Support: This study was supported by the French National Institute of Health and Medical Research (INSERM) and Sorbonne University through a doctoral contract for Ms Vilcu’s PhD thesis.

Role of the Funder/Sponsor: The funders had no role in the design and conduct of the study; collection, management, analysis, and interpretation of the data; preparation, review, or approval of the manuscript; and decision to submit the manuscript for publication.

Additional Contributions: We thank IQVIA France for collecting the drug dispensing data used in this study, particularly the data science team who provided support regarding the access to the LTD (Longitudinal Treatment Dynamics) database, the pharmacies contributing to the LTD database, and the French Sentinelles general practitioners for providing clinical data on acute gastroenteritis activity. None of these contributors received any compensation for this study.

Additional Information: The drug dispensing database used in this study is not publicly available. Aggregated data supporting the findings of this study may be available from the authors upon reasonable request and with permission of IQVIA France. The programming code used in this study may be available from the authors upon request.
